info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lake and eastern Sanders Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Kerr to near Dixon. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rain, low visibility, ponding of water on roadways, winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ravalli, Ronan, St. Ignatius, Old Agency, Dixon, Allentown, Moiese, Kicking Horse, Charlo and Fort Connah. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 N between mile markers 27 and 47. Highway 200 W between mile markers 105 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
